title: Wells Fargo's Preferred Stock, Series R Shares Cross 6% Yield Mark - Nasdaq.com
text: In trading on Wednesday, shares of Wells Fargo & Co's 6.625% Fixed-to-Floating Rate Non-Cumulative Perpetual Class A Preferred Stock, Series R (Symbol: WFC.PRR) were yielding above the 6% mark based on its quarterly dividend (annualized to $1.6562), with shares changing hands as low as $27.58 on the day. This compares to an average yield of 5.42% in the "Financial" preferred stock category, according to  Preferred Stock Channel  . As of last close, WFC.PRR was trading at a 10.80% premium to its liquidation preference amount, versus the average premium of 6.59% in the "Financial" category. Investors should keep in mind that the shares are not cumulative  , meaning that in the event of a missed payment, the company does not have to pay the balance of missed dividends to preferred shareholders before resuming a common dividend.       makeArticleAd();  Below is a dividend history chart for WFC.PRR, showing historical dividend payments on Wells Fargo & Co's 6.625% Fixed-to-Floating Rate Non-Cumulative Perpetual Class A Preferred Stock, Series R :         In Wednesday trading, Wells Fargo & Co's 6.625% Fixed-to-Floating Rate Non-Cumulative Perpetual Class A Preferred Stock, Series R (Symbol: WFC.PRR) is currently up about 0.2% on the day, while the common shares (Symbol: WFC) are up about 1.1%.
